subject: Public Speaking
title: Propaganda: Rhetoric Weaponized
description: A 60-second lesson on Propaganda: Rhetoric Weaponized.

hook.text: Joseph Goebbels said: Repeat a lie often enough and it becomes the truth. He was using rhetoric as a weapon of war.

buildup.text: Propaganda applies every rhetorical technique â€” repetition, emotion, framing â€” but strips out any commitment to truth.

discovery.text: The illusory truth effect confirms it: repeated statements are rated as more true, even when people know better.

twist.text: Democracies aren't immune. Political advertising uses the same repetition and framing techniques as wartime propaganda.

climax.text: The line between persuasion and propaganda is intent: one serves the audience, the other exploits them.

punchline.text: The same tools that inform can also enslave.

quiz.question: What is the illusory truth effect?
options: Repeated statements are rated as more true over time
